com.swirl

Class Beacon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swirl.SObject
      • com.swirl.Signal
        • com.swirl.Beacon
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Config.Beacon

    public class Beacon
extends Signal
    A Beacon object defines a type of Signal that is based on the device's proximity to a Bluetooth beacon, as opposed to a geographic location or wifi network. A beacon aggregates a set of BeaconAdvertisements from a specific beacon device and matches that device with logical location, placement, and custom attributes specified through the platform. When the beacon device comes in range, the BeaconManager will change the state of the beacon and will generate appropriate events and post them to the EventBus.

      static int INVALID_RSSI
      This value for an RSSI indicates that there is not enough information to return a value
      static int STATE_INSIDE
      This value indicates that there are valid advertisements to compute a range and the BeaconManager has determined that the beacon is within the specified range.
      static int STATE_OUTSIDE
      This value indicates that there are valid advertisements to compute a range and the BeaconManager has determined that the beacon is outside of the specified range.
      static int STATE_UNKNOWN
      This value indicates that there are not enough recent advertisements to compute a state.

      • INVALID_RSSI

        public static final int INVALID_RSSI
        This value for an RSSI indicates that there is not enough information to return a value
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENTERED_RSSI

        public static final int ENTERED_RSSI
        This value is for an RSSI that forces a placement/zone entry. For beacons/signals that only generate and enter/exit event.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INVALID_RANGE

        public static final double INVALID_RANGE
        This value for a range indicates that there is not enough information to return a value
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_UNKNOWN

        public static final int STATE_UNKNOWN
        This value indicates that there are not enough recent advertisements to compute a state. Possibly this is a newly detected beacon, or an older beacon that has since timed out.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_OUTSIDE

        public static final int STATE_OUTSIDE
        This value indicates that there are valid advertisements to compute a range and the BeaconManager has determined that the beacon is outside of the specified range.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_INSIDE

        public static final int STATE_INSIDE
        This value indicates that there are valid advertisements to compute a range and the BeaconManager has determined that the beacon is within the specified range.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getThreshold

        public int getThreshold()
        Get the RSSI threshold value. This value is computed from the pathloss threshold sent by the server.
        Returns:
        The RSSI threshold value.

      • isOverlapping

        public boolean isOverlapping()
        Determine if this beacon is part of an overlapping placement or not.
        Returns:
        true if in an overlapping placement, false otherwise

      • getdBm1

        public int getdBm1()
        Returns the 1m measured power. This value can be broadcast as part of the BeaconAdvertisement for some beacon protocols. For others this value is estimated from the transmit power.
        Returns:
        expected RSSI at 1m

      • getExtra

        public java.lang.String getExtra()
        Searches the recent BeaconAdvertisements associated with this beacon to find any TLM or out-of-band data packets and returns that information as a base-64 encoded string.
        Returns:
        base-64 encoded data or null

      • setRssiParams

        public void setRssiParams(org.json.JSONObject params)
        Set a custom RSSI params to control RSSI smoothing opt_sample_age - optimal seconds to average over max_sample_age - maximum seconds to average over if less than min samples min_samples - minimum number of samples to require

      • getRssi

        public int getRssi()
        Computes a RSSI value based on the current working set of BeaconAdvertisements associated with this beacon. The algorithm computes an average by scanning backwards over the last 20 seconds of advertisements. If it cannot find enough samples, it will look back another 10 seconds. If it can find at least 2 samples, then it will return the average.
        Returns:
        average RSSI over the last 20-30 seconds

      • getRange

        public double getRange()
        Compute a range in meters based on the current RSSI estimate.
        Specified by:
        getRange in class Signal
        Returns:
        current distance to the beacon

      • getState

        public int getState()
        Return the current state of the beacon with respect to its threshold.
        Returns:
        STATE_INSIDE if within the beacon range, STATE_OUTSIDE if outside, STATE_UNKNOWN otherwise.

      • getLast

        public BeaconAdvertisement getLast()
        Get the last BeaconAdvertisement received.
        Returns:
        the last beacon advertisement or null.
